definition: to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: He was snapped making sure the windows were sparkling by a resident in a neighbouring apartment block.
sentences.chinese: 他煩惱一定是鄰近公寓樓的住戶讓窗玻璃發出閃光。

sentences.english: The first group of affordable public housing tenants in Shenyang moved into their new homes yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 瀋陽市保障性住房第一批住戶昨天喜遷新居。

sentences.english: Its only inhabitants were a few hunting and fishing tribes.
sentences.chinese: 當地唯一的住戶是幾個以打獵和捕魚爲生的部落。

sentences.english: With 5G, carriers could also deliver super-sharp 4K video to the home.
sentences.chinese: 通過5G，運營商可以向住戶家提供高清4K視頻。

sentences.english: He shrug his low opinion of the occupant of the room.
sentences.chinese: 他聳聳肩表示對那房間的住戶不屑一顧。

sentences.english: We were outvoted by the senior citizens in the community.
sentences.chinese: 我們被社區裏的老住戶給投票擊敗了。

sentences.english: The project addressed the balance between the desire of living in a single-family residence with the cost of the land.
sentences.chinese: 項目將土地成本和單戶式住宅住戶的願望得以平衡。

sentences.english: North flocks old tenants left Beijing property market why splendor faded?
sentences.chinese: 成羣老住戶的離開京北樓市爲何光彩褪色？

sentences.english: We are both little piggies, we are from big cities.
sentences.chinese: 我們兩個是小豬，我們都是城市裏的住戶。

sentences.english: Building deeds might have to be amended to stop tenants hanging out clothes to dry on window frames.
sentences.chinese: 可能要修改大廈公契，以防止住戶在鋁窗晾衫。

sentences.english: Elderly residents enjoying a quality life style in our estates.
sentences.chinese: 長者住戶在屋苑內享受優質的生活。

sentences.english: Sometimes, a building’s inhabitants are the first to notice energy-wasting features.
sentences.chinese: 有時，是大樓住戶首先注意到能耗大的特點。

sentences.english: The present householder will move out by this weekend and I'll move in by next Wednesday.
sentences.chinese: 目前的住戶本週未搬出去，我下星期三搬進去。

sentences.english: They had even taken the son of one tenant to the police station.
sentences.chinese: 他們甚至把一個住戶的孩子帶去了警察局。

sentences.english: The old inhabitant who answered was a tall, gaunt woman.
sentences.chinese: 這個答話的本地老住戶是一個高個兒，瘦身材的女人。

sentences.english: At present, the householder doesn't move out, so I am about to move in next Wednesday.
sentences.chinese: 目前的住戶本週未搬出去，我下星期三搬進去。

definition: property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
unit (of measure)/unit (group of people as a whole)/work unit (place of employment, esp. in the PRC prior to economic reform)/CL:個|个[ge4]
building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
